alert.note: Alert for Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 12:27PM CDT until July 14 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL ROOKS...WESTERN SMITH...EASTERN PHILLIPS AND SOUTHERN FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 1225 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Franklin to Athol to 6 miles southwest of Kirwin, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts, although the main area of large hail will affect southeastern Phillips County. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Athol around 1230 PM CDT. Smith Center and Riverton around 1235 PM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
